metadata.Title: CVE-2018-19965 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Xen through 4.11.x allowing 64-bit PV guest OS users to cause a denial of service (host OS crash) because #GP[0] can occur after a non-canonical address is passed to the TLB flushing code. NOTE: this issue exists because of an incorrect CVE-2017-5754 (aka Meltdown) mitigation.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19965` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxencall1 - 4.11.1-1
libxendevicemodel1 - 4.11.1-1
libxenevtchn1 - 4.11.1-1
libxenforeignmemory1 - 4.11.1-1
libxengnttab1 - 4.11.1-1
libxenmisc4.11 - 4.11.1-1
libxenstore3.0 - 4.11.1-1
libxentoolcore1 - 4.11.1-1
libxentoollog1 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.11-amd64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.11-arm64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.11-armhf - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.9-amd64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.9-arm64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-4.9-armhf - 4.11.1-1
xen-hypervisor-common - 4.11.1-1
xen-system-amd64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-system-arm64 - 4.11.1-1
xen-system-armhf - 4.11.1-1
xen-utils-4.11 - 4.11.1-1
xen-utils-common - 4.11.1-1
xenstore-utils - 4.11.1-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: xen package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.11.1-1').
